newsitem.title: USA: AFLAC says Q1 EPS was $0.63-$0.64.
newsitem.headline: AFLAC says Q1 EPS was $0.63-$0.64.

text.p: An AFLAC Inc executive said Thursday the supplemental insurance carrier's first-quarter net income was "$0.63-$0.64."

"It's in line with the Street, $0.63-$0.64," Kenneth Janke, senior vice president of investor relations, said in an interview during the Robinson-Humphrey annual institutional conference. The company earned $0.59 during the year-ago first quarter that ended March 31, 1996.
Janke said that 1997's first quarter results would be announced on April 22.
He described Wall Street's consensus earnings per share estimates of $2.65 for full-year 1997 and $3.05 for 1998 as "pretty good assumptions."
AFLAC derives about 75 percent of its after-tax earnings from Japan.
During his presentation to analysts, AFLAC's president and chief executive officer, Daniel Amos, said, "I think '97 will be the best year in our history."
